content.description:
Brass Pendant of St. Anthony of Padua Created in Kongo

The pendant depicts Saint Anthony standing and wearing a Catholic monk’s habit.
In his right hand, Saint Anthony holds a cross.
In his left hand, Saint Anthony holds a small figure, possibly an infant.
The pendant’s sheen suggests it is made of metal.
Gift of Ernst Anspach, 1999. The Metropolitan Museum of Art.
content.question: Pendants such as the one in the image were most likely intended for which of the following purposes?

choices.label: Sale to the majority Christian population of the Swahili Coast
Supporting the religious practices of the people of Kongo
Export to Portugal as a profitable trade good
Worshipping in the syncretic Voodoo faith

content.answer: Supporting the religious practices of the people of Kongo
